observation: I can see a signup page with a country/region selection dropdown that is currently open. The search input shows 'United States' and there's a clear button (×) next to it. I can also see 'No result found' message, which suggests the search isn't finding United States in the dropdown options. There are also language selection modals open on the page. I need to close these modals and focus on the main signup form.
reasoning: As a normal user trying to sign up, I need to close the language selection modals first to focus on the main form. I can see a close button (×) in the top right of one of the language modals. After that, I'll need to properly select a country from the dropdown.
ux_issues: Multiple overlapping modals make it confusing to navigate
Country search not finding 'United States' when typed

outcome.visual_observation: The country/region dropdown that was expanded in the BEFORE screenshot showing 'United States' with search functionality and 'No result found' message has been closed in the AFTER screenshot. The dropdown now shows the collapsed 'Select' state. The 'Next' button remains visible and the overall sign-up flow layout is maintained.
